Even though the message had gone out to the Maximals, Tucson could not bare=
 to ignore the radio transmission.  He suspaces his cross bow over his shou=
lder, as the mechanisms over his back latch it in place. 

"Sounds like thi=
s could be important.  I better try to get to the tower, and see what the t=
ransmission is about. Sorry cross bow, you'll have to wait a while".

With =
his sight impaired, he turns to his sonar system atop his helmet, and throw=
s off a sonar wave, which he hoped would bounce off the tower, and back to =
him, giving Tucson the exact coordinates in which to follow.  He also knew =
that being on wheels would be faster than trying to go there on foot.  Meta=
l plates soon shift and within moments he is transformed into his vehicular=
 mode.  The compact SUV shifts himself into all wheel drive, and slowly rol=
ls toward the direction of the tower, which he obtains with sonar system ca=
pability.



--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Kraftlos <kraftlos@...> wrote:

> Perse=
us, please assemble in front of the tower."
> 
> Ravenchief and a team of m=
aximals pulled a large hovercart toward the tower.
> 
> "Is that everything=
?" Salveo asked Ravenchief as they aproached the tower.
> 
> "Yessir, fortu=
nately a couple CR chambers and about half our supplies
> survived the impa=
ct.  This is the last of it."
> 
> "What all this about?" asked Guardia as =
she walked toward the tower.
> 
> "The boss has an announcement," Salveo re=
plied. "He'll be right down,
> so everyone wait here."
> 
> Tag: All Maxima=
ls in Atlantis.
> 
> On 7/12/09, Kraftlos <kraftlos@...> wrote:
> > "I appr=
eciate the research help you have given us over the years,"
> > said Lord P=
erseus.
> >
> > At the top of the Atlantis tower, the mayor's office had a =
bird's eye
> > view of the destroyed city.  It had taken three weeks to cle=
ar the
> > rubble and begin rebuilding; the Maximal base however, was a tot=
al
> > loss: only the lower level remained, which merely contained a
> > de=
stroyed ractor system and the prison cells, which concievably be
> > modifi=
ed to be used by the loca police.
> >
> > "So you'll be leaving us?" asked =
the mayor, already knowing the answer.
> >
> > "Yes.  I've come to the conc=
lusion that our presence in the city
> > merely aggrivates conditions.  Wit=
hout us, this island would become a
> > much lower priority for our enemies=
.  Though I hope we can continue
> > our research together; and I promise w=
e will do anything we can to
> > help the city."
> >
> > "So where will you=
 be going?" the mayor asked after a moment of silence.
> >
> > Perseus walk=
ed to the windows and sighed.
> >
> > "We Maximals have been divided for to=
o long.  With this Unicronian
> > threat, and our recent truce with Megatro=
n. it would be apropriate for
> > us to put our diferences aside and work t=
ogether.  So we'll first be
> > going to meet with Lord Elder."
> >
> > "We=
ll my friend, I wish you the best of success.  You are always welcome
> > h=
ere."
> >
> > "Thank you."
